intro: Psychotria lasiostylis, commonly known as the hairy-styled psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Psychotria lasiostylis is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
